greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n>=1, k>=1, read by antidiagonals: A(n,k) is the number of n-colorings of the complete bipartite graph K_(k,k).
comment: The complete bipartite graph K_(n,n) has 2*n vertices and n^2 = A000290(n) edges. The chromatic polynomial of K_(n,n) has 2*n+1 coefficients.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 1..141, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Complete Bipartite Graph
example: A(3,1) = 6 because there are 6 3-colorings of the complete bipartite graph K_(1,1): 1-2, 1-3, 2-1, 2-3, 3-1, 3-2.
maple: A:= (n, k)-> add(Stirling2(k, j) *mul(n-i, i=0..j-1) *(n-j)^k, j=1..k):
mathematica: a[n_, k_] := Sum[(-1)^j*(n-j)^k*Pochhammer[-n, j]*StirlingS2[k, j], {j, 1, k}]; Table[a[n-k, k], {n, 1, 11}, {k, n-1, 1, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 11 2013 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 30 2012
